properties.context: Four shooters were reported.
properties.suspect: According to a July 5, 2015 MPD press release, four adult male victims were transported to nearby hospitals with apparent gunshot wounds on following a shooting on July 4. One succumbed to his injuries, Algernon Harvey Jones (32). On July 13, eight days after the shooting, MPD published a press release asking for the public's help in idenfying four persons of interest in the case. They can be seen in this video, which MPD included in the press release: https://youtu.be/3nRglVkpv2E. On July 24, 25, and 30, members of the Capital Area Regional Fugitive Task Force arrested 26-year-old Shakim Lyons (26), Jonathan Taylor (24) and Harry Herbert (27) respectively. All three were charged with Second Degree Murder While Armed in connection with Dillard's homicide. Ten months later on April 29, 2016, MPD announced a fourth arrest: James Coffield (24), who was charged with Second Degree Murder While Armed.

properties.context: The shooting occured around 9 PM near the Rhode Island Avenue-Brentwood metro station, according to MPD. A likely motive was a dispute regarding a dice game.
properties.suspect: A suspect has not yet been arrested in this case. Bryan Perkins's homicide remains unsolved. MPD is offering $25,000 for information related to the shooting.
properties.s1: Man Dead, Three Injured After Shooting in Northeast D.C. â€“ NBC4 Washington (nbcwashington.com)

properties.context: MPD officers heard sounds of gunshots and began a canvass of the immediate area.
properties.suspect: No arrest has been made and the case remains under investigation

properties.context: drive-by shooting; public street
properties.suspect: No arrests have been made in relation to this incident and the case remains under investigation, according to MPD.

properties.victims: 2 female juveniles, 1 juvenile male, and 1 adult male
properties.context: The victims were shot between 9 and 10 PM near Eastern Senior High School on the 1700 block of East Capitol St, NE north of the Stadium Armory Metro station.
properties.suspect: Members of the Capital Area Regional Fugitive Task Force and the First District Detectives Office arrested 18-year-old Daniel Evans of SE and charged with Assault of the Dangerous Weapon (Gun) pursuant to a DC Superior Court arrest warrant.

properties.context: Sounds of gunshots called police to scene.
properties.suspect: No arrest has been made and the case remains under investigation

properties.context: Ten gunshots were heard in the vicinity of New York Ave and North Capitol Street NW. Four victims were found with non-life-threatening injuries. An officer on a bike was struck by a car while responding to the incident.
properties.suspect: Two males were arrested in connection with the shooting. An accomplice who did not fire any shots was arrested a week after the shooting. Alan Maybin (33) of NW was arrested on February 10, 2017 by members of the Capital Area Regional Task Force and charged with assault with intent to kill.

properties.context: The sole gunman opened fire at around 11:15 PM near Benning Terrace. MPD was alerted to the incident location by ShotSpotter alerts. Lookout remains a black Nissan Maxima.
properties.suspect: pending

properties.deaths: Zoruan Otto Harris (18), Scorpio-Rodney Alonzo Phillips (31)
properties.victims: 6 adult males, 2 adult females, 1 juvenile male
properties.context: Residents of Southeast D.C. were attending an annual community party with food and drink when shooters opened fire.
properties.suspect: A suspect has not yet been apprehended in this case.

properties.address: 2900 block of Martin Luther King Jr Ave SE
properties.victims: 2 adult males, 1 adult female, 1 juvenile female
properties.context: Shooting occured around 10:30 PM outside a strip of stores in Southeast DC. According to MPD, at least 12 gunshots were fired into a crowd from a passing vehicle. A vehicle of interest was identified on surveillance footage and released to the public on February 17, 2017.
properties.suspect: No arrests have been made and the case remains under investigation.

properties.context: Two gunment opened fire and fled eastbound on Q St NW.
properties.suspect: No arrests have been made and the Algernon Harvey Jones's homicide remains unsolved. The two suspects were last seen fleeing in a black vehicle with tinted windows on surveillance footage.

properties.address: 3100 block of Buena Vista Terrace SE
properties.context: The victims were shot outside the listed location by an unknown suspect in an unknown vehicle. A description of the vehicle could not be provided by witnesses.
properties.suspect: No arrest has been made, and this case remains under active investigation.

properties.context: A ShotSpotter device picked up the sound of 29 shots that were fired along Southern Avenue
properties.suspect: pending

properties.context: Gunmen approached a group of people at an Exxon gas station and started shooting.
properties.suspect: A suspect has not yet been apprehended in this case.

properties.context: At least one suspect inside of a car opened fire on people standing outside of a small market.
properties.suspect: Torey Stockton (20) of District Heights, MD was arrested on June 7, 2018 and charged with First Degree Murder While Armed in the murder of Jasmine Lashai Light.

properties.context: A male in a ski mask approached a group of people in front of the Kenilworth Market and began firing a handgun.
properties.suspect: A suspect has not yet been arrested. This case remains under investigation.

properties.address: 3600 block of New York Ave NE
properties.context: Four males in a sedan were injured by multiple shooters who opened fire from a nearby vehicle in the eastbound lanes of New York Ave NE.
properties.suspect: A suspect has not yet been arrested. This case remains unsolved.

properties.context: MPD responded around 4:30 AM. Two victims had upper body injuries, two had lower body injuries.
properties.suspect: A suspect has not yet been arrested. This case remains under investigation.

properties.victims: 3 adult males, 1 adult female, 1 juvenile female
properties.context: At around 9 PM, four masked men fired over 60 shots into a crowded courtyard of 15-20 people after jumping out of an Infiniti sedan, killing a ten-year-old girl. Eleven total suspects arrested in connnection to the incident were charged with First Degree Murder While Armed or Obstruction of Justice. According to the indictment, all suspects were part of a street gang called the Glizzy Murder Gang of DC's Wellington Park, and the shooting stemmed from disputes with the Clay Terrace neighborhood.
properties.suspect: Between August 2018 and July 2019, MPD arrested the following people in connection to Makiyah Wilson's homicide: Isaiah Murchison (20), Antonio Murchison (26), Saquan Williams (18), Quincy Garvin (19), Gregory Taylor (23), Qujuan Thomas (20), Mark Price (24)

properties.context: Two males opened fire around 11:10 PM.
properties.suspect: Michael Ross (26) of SE was arrested in connection to the shooting on Tuesday, September 25, 2018. The second suspect, Anthony Farmer (27) of NE, was arrested three days later on Friday, September 28. Both suspects were charged with Assault with Intent to Kill (Gun).

properties.context: The suspect pulled out a gun and began firing at around 5:15 PM and fled the scene. Five victims were transported to area hospitals.
properties.suspect: Ronnell Rashicke Offutt (30)

properties.victims: 2 adult females, 1 juvenile female, 1 juvenile male
properties.context: Reports of a shooting at 10:35 am.
properties.suspect: No arrest has been made and the case remains under investigation

properties.context: Two to three unknown suspects in a gray sedan opened fire, hitting five people and damaging a vehicle.
properties.suspect: No arrest has been made and the case remains under investigation

properties.address: 3900 Martin Luther King Jr Ave SW
properties.context: Witnesses reported around 25 shots were fired. Anfernee Vernon Walker was pronounced deceased on the date of the incident. Timothy Richardson died in the hospital on July 24.
properties.suspect: There are no suspects or persons of interest named in this case and it remains under investigation.

properties.context: Four shooting incidents took place across DC on Sunday, July 21, 2019, two of them involving multiple victims. The deadliest was at 2300 block of 15th St NE.
properties.suspect: No arrest has been made and the case remains under investigation

properties.context: One suspect opened fire with a handgun before fleeing the location. Surveillance footage showing the person of interest was released by MPD the day after the incident.
properties.suspect: On Wednesday, December 18, 2019, MPD officers arrested Alessandro Romano (38) of Northwest DC and charged him with Assault With Intent to Kill while Armed (Gun).

properties.context: Suspects inside a car opened fire on the people in the courtyard of an apartment complex.
properties.suspect: No arrests have been made.

properties.victims: 4 adult males, 1 adult female, 1 5-year-old juvenile male
properties.context: On March 6, 2020, three males entered the establishment and were caught on video camera. MPD is currently offering a $20,000 reward to any individual with information that would help identify these persons of interest.
properties.suspect: No arrests have been made.

properties.context: Officers heard gunshots while posted at 318 37th street SE. Two bullet holes were found inside one of the apartments at the location of the shooting. Two of the injured victims were transported to hospitals, while the other two were uncooperative with MPD and refused treatment.
properties.suspect: No arrests have been made..

properties.address: 1200 block of Mt Olivet Rd NE
properties.context: Officers were called to a convenience store in the area of Mount Olivet and West Virginia Ave NE by a 911 call and 20 ShotSpotter alerts near 1234 Simms Place NE. The shooter used a fully automatic handgun.
properties.suspect: No arrests have been made and this incident remains under open investigation.

properties.context: Suspects opened fire at a neighborhood block party in the area of the 3200 block of Brothers Place SE.
properties.suspect: A suspect has not yet been apprehended in this case. Zymia Joyner and Rashard Waldo's homicides remain under investigation.

properties.context: Three armed males opened fire in Columbia Heights on a busy street. Shooting occured just before 5 PM at 14th & Spring.
properties.suspect: No arrest has been made and the case remains under investigation.

properties.context: Multiple shots fired at location around 9:12 PM. MPD was alerted through ShotSpotter alerts. Three victims were transported to the hospital by medics, fourth victim walked into an area emergency room.
properties.suspect: No arrest has been made and the case remains under investigation.

properties.victims: 7 adult males, 11 adult females, 2 juvenile males, 2 unknown adult victims
properties.context: MPD investigators stated there were at least four shooters who fired over 100 rounds total into the crowd of a block party.
properties.suspect: A suspect has not yet been arrested in this case and sole victim Christopher Brown's homicide remains unsolved. On Aug. 10, 2020, MPD announced an investigation into the shootings and a $25,000 reward for information. Two days later on Aug. 12, MPD doubled the reward.

properties.context: First responders placed the shooting around 8:30 PM on Orange Street off Malcolm X Avenue SE. Bobby Plummer died 2 days after the incident at Washington Hospital Center.
properties.suspect: A suspect has not yet been apprehended in this case.

properties.context: Patrol officers responded to the sound of gunshots. One officers was assaulted by an unknown suspect while on lookout.
properties.suspect: No arrest has been made and the case remains under investigation.

properties.context: At least one shooter opened fire instead of a market. MPD responded just before 9 AM to the area of 14th Street and Good Hope Road SE. Four persons of interests was identified as well as a white, two-door Honda Accord. One of the victims, Terrance Oxner, was determined to be a suspect in the case.
properties.suspect: Two suspects have been arrested in this case. Terrance Oxner (21) of maleassas, VA was arrested on Monday, January 25, 2021. Aaron Adgerson (17) was arrested on Monday, March 22, 2021 and charged as an adult. Both suspects were charged with First Degree Murder While Armed.

properties.address: 3900 Martin Luther King Jr Ave SW
properties.context: "Police said shots were fired both inside and outside the store. Pictures taken by WUSA9 show damage inside of the store, including a food kiosk damaged by two bullet holes. A security camera was also damaged in the shooting, according to police."
properties.suspect: A suspect was captured by a nearby surveillance camera. A press release seeking information was published on March 4, 2021, the same day of the shooting. MPD told DC Witness a suspect or person of interest has not yet been named, and that the shooting remains under investigation (email correspondence).

properties.context: According to an MPD release, members of the Capital Area Regional Fugitive Task Force arrested Tarik Turner (25) on Wednesday, April 28, 2021 in connection to the shooting. Turner was charged with Second Degree Murder While Armed in the homicide of Keosha Ferguson. Turner was listed in the incident report as an injured shooting victim.
properties.suspect: Tarik Turner (25)

properties.context: Five males opened fire on the street near a charter and middle school, injuring 5 victims.
properties.weapon: A victim recalled seeing two handguns.
properties.suspect: Five suspects fled the scene and nobody could provide a detailed description beyond a black male with an orange jacket and a high fade hair cut. No arrest has been made since, and the case remains under investigation.

properties.address: 1800 block of West Virginia Ave NE
properties.context: ShotSpotter identified 12 rounds fired on the 1800 block of Capitol Avenue NE. Victims found on the scene and on the 2200 block of 15th St NE were transported to the hospital with non-life-threatening injuries.
properties.suspect: No arrest has been made and the case remains under investigation. The latest lookout was of a silver sedan occupied by two black males. One suspect was described to have been wearing a red and gray hooded sweatshirt, jeans, and white shoes.

properties.context: MPD received reports of shots fired around 11:34 AM. Victims were found on the 200 block of 37th Place and the 100 block of Ridge Road SE. The initial investigation showed one adult male getting out of a black Audi A4 and opening fire.
properties.suspect: A suspect has not yet been named. Sole victim Anwar Christian's homicide remains on MPD's list of 2021 unsolved murders.
properties.s2: Quadruple shooting SE DC middle of the day | wusa9.com

properties.context: According to court documents, Juan Peterson shot Lester Howard in retaliation following a verbal altercation. Peterson pulled up to the incident location in a car and opened fire on the street, killing Howard and injuring three others.
properties.suspect: Juan Peterson (31) of NE was arrested on September 14, 2021 and charged with First Degree Murder While Armed in the homicide of Lester Howard.
properties.s2: Arrest Made in a Homicide: 3900 Block of Minnesota Avenue, Northeast (google.com)

properties.context: ShotSpotter detected 14 rounds fired in the rear of 301 49th St NE on the football field. While en route, dispatcher advised officers that there were multiple calls for individuals shot in the 300 block of 50th St NE.
properties.suspect: No arrests have been made and the case remains under investigation.

properties.victims: 3 adult males, 2 adult females, 1 juvenile female
properties.context: Seventh District patrol officers heard gunshots in the area and responded around 11:11 PM. Nyiah Courtney was riding a scooter when she was shot. According to the Washington Post, Courtney's father, who was arrested by MPD the next day on drug and firearms charges, may have been the target of the attack.
properties.suspect: MPD arrested 22-year-old Marktwan Hargraves of Walford, MD on July 28, 2021 in connection with the shooting and charged him with Second Degree Murder While Armed.

properties.context: Seventh District patrol officers overheard gunshots at 5:25 PM on the 3500 block of 22nd St SE.
properties.suspect: No arrests have been made and the case remains under investigation.

properties.address: 3600 block of New York Ave NE
properties.context: Officers were flagged down by a victim suffering from a gunshot wound.
properties.suspect: No arrests have been made and the case remains under investigation.

properties.deaths: Keenan Braxton (24), Donnetta Dyson (31), Johnny Joyner (37)
properties.context: At least one shooter pulled up to a Northwest DC home in a dark-colored four-door Honda Accord with tinted windows and opened fire into a crowd around 7:30 PM.
properties.suspect: A suspect has not yet been named.
A suspect has not yet been named.
